Yes it is! here is the few reasons..  Your life is beautiful because… 1.There is no right or wrong thing… “things are just as it is”. Your perception = your experience = your life. 2.You are YOU – nobody is like you…all your lessons and experiences have created the beautiful and authentic person that you are today. 3.Situations push people to act in certain ways; in most cases people's behaviour is not intentional rather circumstantial bcz of the tensions they have or the struggles they are facing . it means that something might have happened to them causing such behaviour. Don't judge people harshly. 4.You have 24 hrs eachday. A lot can be achieved in one day. 5.Your answers are there within you.Just quieten your mind and listen to your soul. 6.Be generous in one way or other; Really life is all about generosity. 7.life gives you everything to succeed. 8.You have a voice and the freedom to take decisions. You can make a difference. Really. Its just need you to believe in you & a start! 9.Every new day is a chance to find new opportunities and learn more about yourself. 10.laugh uncontrollably. You know how it feels. 11.People surprise you often when you least expect it. 12.You know how bad are the situation you face and but you can now look back and see how it has made you even more stronger. 13.Your body is like a car.without maintenance fee & oil,it will be rusted. Just like your body,only when you fuel it with good oil it supports you. 14.You have a happy & supporting family.☺️ 15.congrats to have a warm house to go home to every night. 16.look! Opportunities to learn and grow are everywhere! 17.Success always comes in any form just after you had the agitating desire to give up. 18.Happiness is something to choice for not a destination. 19.The most precious thing in life is(in my prospect) – meeting the love of your life, the sensation of butterflies and the first kiss is something you can look forward to. 20.If you are a couple – sitting on the porch while drinking tea and chatting about the old times is always a beautiful thing. 21.You are fortunate.you have fresh water to drink, swim and bath in. 22.whats your passion? Get curious and find out what lights you up –what twinkles your eyes when you think or talk or write about it. think about what you would do every day even if you did not get paid. Take steps towards this dream until it is yours. 23.With age you are getting wiser. 24.You are good enough. You are perfect just as the way you are. 25.Acceptence is the key. Know that everything is as it should be – don’t try and especially force things. 26.Yes! Words have power. they have power to change lives. Just a little positive words to your spouse can make his or her day or even entire life. 27.Choose your words wisely – speak positively to yourself and to others. 28.Smile when you start or end a conversation! You don't know but with just your smiling you can turn the table around & can even win your audience heart. 29.You have been inspired by others and the same way you have inspired others. This make you connected with others. 30.You have been brave. You are brave. 31.You get that all warm and fuzzy feeling when you see animals play. 32.Do you have felt inspired as well as touched through witnessing a random act of kindness. 33.You have surrendered and let go. 34.You have persevered till you get success. 35.You have been uplifted ,energised, passionated & motivated to succeed by the warmth of your family. 36.Fresh air .fresh water is treasure ,still available on Earth. 37.You have dreams. If you were able to dream it up, then it is possible that you make it happen. 38.Sometimes, without your conscience, a stranger has made your day a little easier. 39.Somebody has said the nessesary words you needed to hear…right at the moment you needed to hear them. How beautiful? 40.You have a great chemistry with somebody. He/she gets you very easily . They totally understand all your idiotness. Isnt this thing is so so fulfilling & beautiful for you? 41.The possibilities are endless. 42.You have a job. 43.You can hear, speak and walk. 44.If you don’t have something that most people have…then that is one of your greatest strengths.have gratitude for this that others don't have. 45.You are humble and walk with grace. 46.You have enough money to nourish your body today, tomorrow and for the next month. 47.You have instincts – an internal guide that lets you know what to do. A very powerful tool sometimes. 48.Someone has given you a big warm & very tight hug that left you feeling loved and accepted. Isn't this thing only takes all of your tension out? 49.You have walked in the sunset in Goa and released all your cares and worries. 50.You have choices. 51.You have now. That is all that counts. 52.Believe in miracles. Miracles exist, wonderful things are happening to people every day.yay! 53.Bad times and pain are only temporary. 54.The world needs to listen to you .People are waiting to hear you speak. Be confident in what you said even it's wrong. 55.See your around. Sometimes the eminent beauty and the biggest lessons can be found in the simplest of things. 56.On your first date, You say hello first. 57.The universe talks to you on a regular basis. Coincidence, intuition, luck, fate, serendipity, closure…they are all signs. the signs that you are connecting. 58.Things are not always as they seem. You must be a good observer to know what is around the scene. 59.Your reality is based on your perception – you can always change your perception. 60.It is never too late to dream again. You have a goal.you are here for it. One bonus point: You are never too old to love somebody.;) PS: So, here it is. These are my 60 points on the topic ,I need to add more . Can you people suggest more. Now, IAM waiting for your suggestions. I will add them further if you will help me suggest more on the same topic: WHY LIFE IS BEAUTIFUL? :) If you liked my efforts in creating this stuff, Plz make a small effort to click upvote as it can bring a smile on my face, & would also motivate me to write more answers like this. Thank you & best of luck. :)

A sweet short story with a great lesson.Worth Reading! A building construction work was going on. Lots of poor labourers were working there and their small children used to hold onto one another's shirt and play "train-train".Someone would become the engine and others would become bogies. Every day these children used to take turns becoming the engine and bogies.But there was one small boy wearing only a half pant who used to hold one small green cloth in his hand and become the guard daily. So the person who was observing them went to him and asked him Son, don't you also wish to become an engine or a bogie some time ? He softly replied .. Sir , I don't have a shirt to wear so how will the other children catch me to make the train? That person could see the slight wetness in his eyes. But he learnt a lesson on that day that the boy could have cried and sat at home and abused his parents for not affording to buy him a shirt. But instead he chose another way to play and enjoy himself. In life, we don't get all things we desire and we keep complaining . I dont have a bike, I don't have car , I don't have this or that etc... Life is like that.We need to make it beautiful and be grateful for what we have.Have an attitude of gratitude.  Life may not always be easy. It may not always be comfortable and joyful. But it always manages to surprise us and to provide us with exciting opportunities for growth.There are so many wonderful and awe-inspiring aspects of life that it would be difficult to list them all. Just think about the magnificent view of the sunrise and sunset. Or think about the marvelous times you’ve had spending the evening in nature and watching the stars. Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams. -Ashley Smith Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Be grateful. Thanks for reading!

My dog recently died. My heart felt like it busted open. We put him down in our backyard. An hour later we had a beautiful rainbow over our house. We are camping in RV, something we’ve never done before. We put the water in the wrong water hole and our toilet started overflowing with poop. After we cleaned it up, we sat around the campfire. Our son roasting marshmallows while we laughed big hearty laughs that wouldn’t stop. Covid-19 shut us all up in our houses. Every time I hung up the phone I said, ““I love you” to a friend or family member on the other end. I think life is beautiful; but it is most beautiful when you are able to see the snippets of joy, beauty and love through difficult times. It’s very much like the rainbow. A burst of sunshine and color through grey clouds.

Beautiful question!  Roses are beautiful, indescribably so. But they usually have thorns, this may be a defense for the rose to protect from scavengers attracted to its smell. So, pardon the cliche analogy but life is in a lot of ways like the rose. Lie is indescribably beautiful with infinite riches unfolding, but the condition of that beauty brings with it the other side of the coin. The other side of the coin includes harsh, brutal, ugly parts of life much like the rose’s thorns that can make one bleed.  Does the ugly, brutal side of life take away from the side of life where there are unbounded beauty and goodness and where infinite riches are unfolding each second? Not necessarily. Billions throughout the ages might testify from different angles about how tapping into life’s beauty, goodness and riches helped them get through the worst. Sometimes it seems like dark clouds and haze are overcasting the moon:  But the moon still glows and absorbs light from the sun even if far from our view:

“Do you think life is beautiful? Why?” Life indeed is beautiful! It teaches us so much. Not only about others, but about ourselves. It teaches us that all things repeat themselves over and over, until we learn the value, the meaning in them. Once we have learned, we go on to the next “lesson” Sometimes our path, our journey meshes with someone else’s and we get lucky, we have a “guide” a partner along the way. Other times, we must travel alone. Sometimes, we are the teacher, it is our (do I say, destiny) to share what we have learned with others, and help them along their path. It wasn't until recently that I discovered this. That I was ready and willing to share. I would have been too shy to do so before. There is a difference in karma and dharma. Karma being what the world gives to us or what we find. Dharma is our gifts back to the world. It took me a long time to see. Embrace others, appreciate and live in the moment.

Yes-in some way. It could be an inner beauty of soul or purpose. Certainly Mother Theresa was not beautiful in any conventional sense of beauty, but she was beautiful in her selfless service to the lepers and poor of India. Mahatma Ghandi was a skinny, bald headed guy who was bug eyed and worn glasses-hardly handsome in any way. Yet he led millions on the path of non-violent resistance and won independence for his country. Nelson Mandela was a tall, lanky man with skin tags on a blotched face. He spent many years in prison-and came out to lead his countrymen to conquer apartheid in South Africa.  Beauty is far more that an unblemished face or a body that a society deems 'perfect'. Those are pretty-merely pretty. Pretty fades like a summer flower. Beauty lasts-sometimes for centuries. I'll take the glorious art of da Vinci over the pages of People magazine or the catwalks of Vogue any day.
